intro: Leptoderris dewevrei, commonly known as the African moonseed, is a climbing plant native to tropical Africa. It belongs to the family Menispermaceae and is characterized by its slender, woody stems and compound leaves. The plant produces small, greenish-yellow flowers followed by distinctive, elongated fruits that contain smooth, round seeds. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in forest understories. Due to its unique morphology and ecological role, it is of interest to botanists and conservationists.
